players.name: Alice
memory: You're Alice, the villager.
Night 1 begins.
Diana was found dead.
Day 1 begins.
Bob: "Charlie is the mafioso. I used my detective ability last night and confirmed it."

Charlie: "Bold claim, Bob. If you’re real, why out yourself Day 1 with no proof? Alice, think: a fake-claiming mafioso would say exactly this to force a mislynch. Let’s hear Alice’s take before rushing a vote."
You: "Bob, if you're truly the detective, outing yourself so early is risky. Charlie, your defense is logical, but doesn't clear suspicion. This is tough, but I'll need more to decide."

You: "Charlie, while Bob's claim is bold, it could very well be a tactic to make us doubt him. If Bob is right, ignoring his claim would be disastrous. Bob, can you provide any more reasons why we should trust your claim?"

Charlie: "Bob has no proof and conveniently ‘confirms’ me after Diana’s death when no one can counterclaim. Alice, if Bob were real, he’d fear night kill and hold results; instead he rushes a mislynch. Let’s vote Bob."
Bob: "Charlie is deflecting with logic but lacks evidence. As the detective, I risked outing myself because knowing the mafioso early lets us win before more town members die. Trust my findings."
Votes: Alice voted for Charlie, Bob voted for Charlie, Charlie voted for Bob
Charlie was arrested
